author: AceShowbiz.com
title: Artist of the Week: Future
text:
Comments After topping Billboard 200 with his 'DS2' a few months ago, Future earns his second No. 1 album on the chart with his and Drake's 'What a Time to Be Alive'. 
It didn't take Future too long to return to the top spot of Billboard 200. After scoring his first No. 1 set back in July with his third studio album " DS2 ", the rapper recently ruled the chart again with his and Drake 's joint mixtape, " What a Time to Be Alive ". The project was released just a day after it was officially announced in late September. It also became the second No. 1 effort for Drake who topped the list in February with his other surprise mixtape, " If You're Reading This It's Too Late ". With the arrival of "What a Time to Be Alive", both Drake and Future simultaneously became the first hip-hop acts to have two No. 1 albums in a calendar year since Jay-Z did so in 2004 with his and R. Kelly 's " Unfinished Business ", and a collaborative album with Linkin Park called " Collision Course ". With 375,000 equivalent album units collected in its first week, Future and Drake's tape posted the third-largest sales week of 2015 behind Drizzy's "IYRTITL" which remains the biggest-seller with 535,000 and fellow Canadian star The Weeknd 's " Beauty Behind the Madness " (412,000).
